text: Papa Don't Preach is a pop single by American singer Madonna. ==Overview== Papa Don't Preach deals with abortion and pregnancy. It was released in Madonna's third studio album True Blue (1986), which was also recorded in her album The Immaculate Collection (1990). The song ranked No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 for two weeks. ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== Chart (1986) Peak position Australia (Kent Music Report) 1 Brazil (Pro-Música Brasil) 9 Denmark (IFPI) 1 El Salvador (IFPI) 2 European Hot 100 Singles (Music & Media) 1 European Airplay Top 50 (Music & Media) 1 Finland (Suomen virallinen lista) 1 Guatemala (IFPI) 1 Greece (IFPI) 1 Iceland (RÚV) 2 Italy (Musica e dischi) 1 Japan (Oricon Singles Chart) 36 Guatemala (IFPI) 9 Panama (UPI) 1 Portugal (Associação Fonográfica Portuguesa) 1 Spain (Productores de Música de España) 4 South Africa (Radio Orion) 4 US Cash Box Top 100 Singles 1 US Radio & Records Contemporary hit radio (CHR) & Pop Charts 1 === Year-end charts === Chart (1986) Position Australia (Kent Music Report) 9 Austria (Ö3 Austria Top 40) 21 Belgium (Ultratop 50 Flanders) 6 Brazil (Brazilian Radio Airplay) 70 Canada Top Singles (RPM) 13 Denmark (Hitlisten) 6 European Hot 100 Singles (Music & Media) 1 France (SNEP) 35 Germany (Official German Charts) 18 Italy (Musica e dischi) 6 Netherlands (Dutch Top 40) 9 Netherlands (Single Top 100) 13 New Zealand (Recorded Music NZ) 13 Norway (VG-lista) 9 Switzerland (Schweizer Hitparade) 14 UK Singles (OCC) 8 US Billboard Hot 100 29 US Dance Club Songs (Billboard) 43 US Dance/Electronic Singles Sales (Billboard) 29 US Cash Box Top 100 Singles 18 ===Decade-end charts=== Chart (1980–1989) Position Netherlands (Dutch Top 40) 75 ===All-time charts=== Chart (1958–2018) Position US Billboard Hot 100 579 ==References== Category:Pop songs Category:1986 songs Category:Madonna songs
